result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

JA contacted PD Office on this date to inquire whether Def. contacted them about an attorney. JA was informed that Defendant's girlfriend contacted their office but was told that Def. himself needed to call. As of today's date, he has not called them. PD Office also confirmed that Def. is still in the Olmsted Co. MN jail. RJG
DE's copy of NOH for 8/10 and 9/1 hearing, letter regarding bond and bond to be signed. RTS/Not Deliverable as Addressed/UTF. kma
from Clerk of Court to DE requesting DE signature on bond and return 2 copies of bond in the SASE by 7/28/22. Bond mailed to the DE on 7/18/22. bph
DE's NOH for 7/14 INIT w/ complaint. RTS/Refused/UTF. kma

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Fleet Farm in Hudson WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Maintain status at Teen Challenge

- Prior to leaving the courthouse, report for mugshots and fingerprints.  

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

12:00 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marc Thomas Seay appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Marc Thomas Seay.   DE updates address, will be at this address for the next year.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  DE needs to complete mugs and prints.  DE to contact PD's office.
